records.title: Understanding ProjectFlow Plans: Free vs Basic vs Premium vs Enterprise
records.content:
# Understanding ProjectFlow Plans: Free vs Basic vs Premium vs Enterprise

This comprehensive guide covers everything you need to know about billing and subscriptions in ProjectFlow.

## Overview
ProjectFlow provides flexible billing options designed to work with businesses of all sizes. From free plans for small teams to enterprise solutions for large organizations, we have a plan that fits your needs.

## Key Features
- Flexible monthly and annual billing cycles
- Prorated charges for mid-cycle changes
- Multiple payment methods accepted
- Transparent pricing with no hidden fees
- Easy upgrade and downgrade process
- Automatic invoicing and receipts

## How It Works
1. Select your plan tier based on your team size and needs
2. Choose your billing cycle (monthly or annual)
3. Add your payment method
4. Receive automatic invoices on your billing date
5. Manage your subscription anytime

## Common Questions
**Q: Can I change my plan anytime?**
A: Yes, you can upgrade or downgrade at any time. Changes take effect on your next billing date with prorated adjustments.

**Q: What payment methods do you accept?**
A: We accept credit cards (Visa, Mastercard, Amex), bank transfers, and PayPal.

**Q: Do you offer discounts?**
A: Yes, annual billing provides 15-20% savings, and volume discounts are available for Enterprise customers.

**Q: What happens if a payment fails?**
A: We'll notify you immediately and retry collection over several days. Contact support if you need to update your payment method.

## Need Help?
For billing questions, contact billing@projectflow.com or use the in-app support chat.

records.title: Troubleshooting Login Issues and Password Recovery
records.content:
# Troubleshooting Login Issues and Password Recovery

## Problem Description
This article addresses technical issues and provides troubleshooting steps to resolve common problems.

## Symptoms
- Application not responding
- Slow performance
- Data sync issues
- Login failures
- Connection problems

## Troubleshooting Steps

### Step 1: Verify Your Connection
Check your internet connection speed and stability. ProjectFlow works best with 5+ Mbps download speed.

### Step 2: Clear Cache
Clear your browser cache, cookies, and local storage:
- Chrome: Ctrl+Shift+Delete
- Safari: Preferences → Privacy
- Firefox: Ctrl+Shift+Delete

### Step 3: Update Your Browser
Ensure you're using the latest version of your browser.

### Step 4: Disable Extensions
Temporarily disable browser extensions that might interfere with ProjectFlow.

### Step 5: Try a Different Browser

records.title: Import Data Issues and Troubleshooting
records.content:
# Import Data Issues and Troubleshooting

## Problem Description
This article addresses technical issues and provides troubleshooting steps to resolve common problems.

## Symptoms
- Application not responding
- Slow performance
- Data sync issues
- Login failures
- Connection problems

## Troubleshooting Steps

### Step 1: Verify Your Connection
Check your internet connection speed and stability. ProjectFlow works best with 5+ Mbps download speed.

### Step 2: Clear Cache
Clear your browser cache, cookies, and local storage:
- Chrome: Ctrl+Shift+Delete
- Safari: Preferences → Privacy
- Firefox: Ctrl+Shift+Delete

### Step 3: Update Your Browser
Ensure you're using the latest version of your browser.

### Step 4: Disable Extensions
Temporarily disable browser extensions that might interfere with ProjectFlow.

### Step 5: Try a Different Browser
Test in a different browser (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge) to isolate the issue.

## Advanced Troubleshooting

### Browser Console
Press F12 to open Developer Tools and check the Console for error messages.

### Network Tab
Use the Network tab to check for failed requests and identify issues.

### Application Storage
Check Application → Storage to verify data is being saved correctly.

## Still Having Issues?
Contact support@projectflow.com with:
- Browser and version
- Operating system
- Description of the issue
- Steps to reproduce
- Browser console errors

records.title: Getting Started with ProjectFlow: Your First Project
records.content:
# Getting Started with ProjectFlow: Your First Project

## Overview
This guide walks you through using ProjectFlow features effectively to manage your projects and collaborate with your team.

## Key Features
- Multiple view options (List, Board, Timeline, Calendar)
- Real-time collaboration
- File sharing and comments
- Automation and workflows
- Time tracking
- Reporting and analytics

## How to Get Started

### 1. Create a Project
Click "New Project" and fill in the basic details. Choose a template that matches your workflow.

### 2. Add Tasks
Create tasks by clicking "Add Task" or drag items from your backlog.

### 3. Assign and Schedule
Assign tasks to team members and set due dates to organize work.

### 4. Collaborate
Add comments, attachments, and use @mentions to communicate.

### 5. Track Progress
Use your preferred view (Kanban, Timeline, etc.) to monitor progress.

### 6. Generate Reports
Create reports to analyze productivity and project health.

## Best Practices
- Use consistent naming conventions
- Set clear due dates
- Communicate in task comments
- Update task status regularly
- Review progress weekly
- Use templates for repeated work

## Common Use Cases
- Project planning
- Team task management
- Agile/Scrum workflows
- Kanban processes
- Resource allocation
- Time tracking

## Tips and Tricks
- Use keyboard shortcuts for speed
- Create saved filters for common views

records.title: Creating and Managing Projects
records.content:
# Creating and Managing Projects

## Overview
This guide walks you through using ProjectFlow features effectively to manage your projects and collaborate with your team.

## Key Features
- Multiple view options (List, Board, Timeline, Calendar)
- Real-time collaboration
- File sharing and comments
- Automation and workflows
- Time tracking
- Reporting and analytics

## How to Get Started

### 1. Create a Project
Click "New Project" and fill in the basic details. Choose a template that matches your workflow.

### 2. Add Tasks
Create tasks by clicking "Add Task" or drag items from your backlog.

### 3. Assign and Schedule
Assign tasks to team members and set due dates to organize work.

### 4. Collaborate
Add comments, attachments, and use @mentions to communicate.

### 5. Track Progress
Use your preferred view (Kanban, Timeline, etc.) to monitor progress.

### 6. Generate Reports
Create reports to analyze productivity and project health.

## Best Practices
- Use consistent naming conventions
- Set clear due dates
- Communicate in task comments
- Update task status regularly
- Review progress weekly
- Use templates for repeated work

## Common Use Cases
- Project planning
- Team task management
- Agile/Scrum workflows
- Kanban processes
- Resource allocation
- Time tracking

## Tips and Tricks
- Use keyboard shortcuts for speed
- Create saved filters for common views
- Set up automation to save time
- Use custom fields for better organization
- Enable notifications for important updates

## Learn More
For advanced features, see our comprehensive feature guides.

records.title: Setting Up Two-Factor Authentication (2FA)
records.content:
# Setting Up Two-Factor Authentication (2FA)

## Overview
This article covers account management, security settings, and compliance features in ProjectFlow.

## Key Topics
- Account security
- Team management
- Access control
- Compliance
- Data protection

## Important Security Features

### Two-Factor Authentication
Enable 2FA to add an extra layer of security to your account. Supported methods:
- Authenticator apps
- SMS codes
- Email codes

### Strong Passwords
Use passwords with:
- Minimum 12 characters
- Mix of uppercase and lowercase
- Numbers and special characters
- No personal information

### API Key Security
- Generate unique keys per integration
- Rotate keys regularly
- Delete unused keys
- Monitor key usage

## Team Permissions

### Role Hierarchy
- Owner: Full access
- Admin: Project management
- Editor: Content creation
- Viewer: Read-only access

### Setting Permissions
1. Go to Team Settings
2. Select user
3. Choose role
4. Save

## Compliance

ProjectFlow is compliant with:
- SOC2 Type II
- GDPR
- HIPAA
- CCPA

Contact compliance@projectflow.com for compliance documentation.

## Data Protection
- Data encrypted at rest
- HTTPS for data in transit
- Regular security audits
- Incident response plan
- Regular backups

## Need Help?
For security concerns, contact security@projectflow.com.

## Related Articles
- Two-Factor Authentication
- API Key Management
- Compliance Certifications

records.title: API Key Security Best Practices
records.content:
# API Key Security Best Practices

## Overview
This article covers account management, security settings, and compliance features in ProjectFlow.

## Key Topics
- Account security
- Team management
- Access control
- Compliance
- Data protection

## Important Security Features

### Two-Factor Authentication
Enable 2FA to add an extra layer of security to your account. Supported methods:
- Authenticator apps
- SMS codes
- Email codes

### Strong Passwords
Use passwords with:
- Minimum 12 characters
- Mix of uppercase and lowercase
- Numbers and special characters
- No personal information

### API Key Security
- Generate unique keys per integration
- Rotate keys regularly
- Delete unused keys
- Monitor key usage

## Team Permissions

### Role Hierarchy
- Owner: Full access
- Admin: Project management
- Editor: Content creation
- Viewer: Read-only access

### Setting Permissions
1. Go to Team Settings
2. Select user
3. Choose role
4. Save

## Compliance

ProjectFlow is compliant with:
- SOC2 Type II
- GDPR
- HIPAA
- CCPA

Contact compliance@projectflow.com for compliance documentation.

## Data Protection
- Data encrypted at rest
- HTTPS for data in transit
- Regular security audits
- Incident response plan
- Regular backups

## Need Help?
For security concerns, contact security@projectflow.com.

## Related Articles
- Two-Factor Authentication

- Compliance Certifications

# Bankruptcy and Account Closure

## Overview
This article covers account management, security settings, and compliance features in ProjectFlow.

## Key Topics
- Account security
- Team management
- Access control
- Compliance
- Data protection

## Important Security Features

### Two-Factor Authentication
Enable 2FA to add an extra layer of security to your account. Supported methods:
- Authenticator apps
- SMS codes
- Email codes

### Strong Passwords
Use passwords with:
- Minimum 12 characters
- Mix of uppercase and lowercase
- Numbers and special characters
- No personal information

### API Key Security
- Generate unique keys per integration
- Rotate keys regularly
- Delete unused keys
- Monitor key usage

## Team Permissions

### Role Hierarchy
- Owner: Full access
- Admin: Project management
- Editor: Content creation
- Viewer: Read-only access

### Setting Permissions
1. Go to Team Settings
2. Select user

- SOC2 Type II

records.title: Slack Integration: Setup and Usage
records.content:
# Slack Integration: Setup and Usage

## Overview
Learn how to set up and use integrations to connect ProjectFlow with your other business tools.

## Features
- Pre-built integrations
- OAuth authentication
- Webhook support
- Real-time sync
- Error handling
- Custom mappings

## Setup Process

### Step 1: Navigate to Integrations
Go to Settings → Integrations and find the tool you want to connect.

### Step 2: Authorize
Click "Connect" and authorize ProjectFlow to access your account.

### Step 3: Configure
Map fields, choose sync direction, and customize behavior.

### Step 4: Test
Verify the integration works by creating a test item.

### Step 5: Monitor
Track sync status and troubleshoot any issues.

## Common Integrations

**Slack**: Receive notifications and manage tasks
**GitHub**: Link code to tasks
**Salesforce**: Sync opportunities and accounts
**Jira**: Maintain parallel task tracking
**Google Workspace**: Integrate docs and calendars
**Zapier**: Connect 1000+ apps

## Troubleshooting

### Integration Not Syncing
1. Check authorization status
2. Verify API credentials
3. Review error logs
4. Check rate limits
5. Test connectivity

### Data Mapping Issues
1. Verify field mappings
2. Check data types
3. Review transformation rules
4. Test with sample data

## Best Practices
- Start with one integration
- Test thoroughly before going live
- Monitor sync logs regularly
- Plan for data conflicts
- Document custom mappings

## Support
For integration support, contact integrations@projectflow.com.

records.title: SDK Installation: Python
records.content:
# SDK Installation: Python

## Overview
Learn how to set up and use integrations to connect ProjectFlow with your other business tools.

## Features
- Pre-built integrations
- OAuth authentication
- Webhook support
- Real-time sync
- Error handling
- Custom mappings

## Setup Process

### Step 1: Navigate to Integrations
Go to Settings → Integrations and find the tool you want to connect.

### Step 2: Authorize
Click "Connect" and authorize ProjectFlow to access your account.

### Step 3: Configure
Map fields, choose sync direction, and customize behavior.

### Step 4: Test
Verify the integration works by creating a test item.

### Step 5: Monitor
Track sync status and troubleshoot any issues.

## Common Integrations

**Slack**: Receive notifications and manage tasks
**GitHub**: Link code to tasks
**Salesforce**: Sync opportunities and accounts
**Jira**: Maintain parallel task tracking
**Google Workspace**: Integrate docs and calendars
**Zapier**: Connect 1000+ apps

## Troubleshooting

### Integration Not Syncing
1. Check authorization status
2. Verify API credentials
3. Review error logs
4. Check rate limits
5. Test connectivity

### Data Mapping Issues
1. Verify field mappings
2. Check data types
3. Review transformation rules
4. Test with sample data

## Best Practices
- Start with one integration
- Test thoroughly before going live
- Monitor sync logs regularly
- Plan for data conflicts
- Document custom mappings

## Support
For integration support, contact integrations@projectflow.com.

Learn how to set up and use integrations to connect ProjectFlow with your other business tools.

## Features
- Pre-built integrations
- OAuth authentication
- Webhook support
- Real-time sync
- Error handling
- Custom mappings

## Setup Process

### Step 1: Navigate to Integrations
Go to Settings → Integrations and find the tool you want to connect.

### Step 2: Authorize
Click "Connect" and authorize ProjectFlow to access your account.

### Step 3: Configure
Map fields, choose sync direction, and customize behavior.

### Step 4: Test
Verify the integration works by creating a test item.

### Step 5: Monitor
Track sync status and troubleshoot any issues.

## Common Integrations

**Slack**: Receive notifications and manage tasks
**GitHub**: Link code to tasks
**Salesforce**: Sync opportunities and accounts
**Jira**: Maintain parallel task tracking
**Google Workspace**: Integrate docs and calendars
**Zapier**: Connect 1000+ apps

## Troubleshooting

### Integration Not Syncing
1. Check authorization status
2. Verify API credentials
3. Review error logs
4. Check rate limits
5. Test connectivity

### Data Mapping Issues
1. Verify field mappings
2. Check data types
3. Review transformation rules
4. Test with sample data

## Best Practices
- Start with one integration
- Test thoroughly before going live
- Monitor sync logs regularly
- Plan for data conflicts
- Document custom mappings

## Support
For integration support, contact integrations@projectflow.com.

records.title: Product Overview: What is ProjectFlow?
records.content:
# Product Overview: What is ProjectFlow?

## Overview
This article provides detailed information about ProjectFlow's capabilities, plans, and value proposition.

## Key Benefits
- Easy to use interface
- Flexible for any workflow
- Scalable pricing
- Powerful features
- Excellent support
- Strong security

## Plan Options

**Free**: Perfect for small teams starting out
- 3 users
- 5 projects
- Basic features

**Basic**: For growing teams
- $12/user/month
- 10 projects
- Time tracking
- Basic reporting

**Premium**: For expanding organizations
- $24/user/month
- Unlimited projects
- Advanced features
- Integrations

**Enterprise**: For large organizations
- Custom pricing
- Dedicated support
- Custom features
- SLA guarantees

## Why Choose ProjectFlow?

### Ease of Use
ProjectFlow is intuitive and requires minimal training. Your team will be productive from day one.

### Flexibility
Whether you use Agile, Kanban, Waterfall, or a custom workflow, ProjectFlow adapts to you.

### Scalability
Start small and scale up as your team grows. ProjectFlow grows with you.

### Integration
Connect with 50+ tools your team already uses.

### Security
Enterprise-grade security with SOC2, GDPR, HIPAA compliance.

## Who Uses ProjectFlow?
- 100,000+ teams worldwide
- Startups to Fortune 500 companies
- Every industry and team size
- Global organizations

## Getting Started
Start your free trial today. No credit card required.

Compare plans and choose the perfect fit for your team.

# Adoption Best Practices: Getting Your Team Using ProjectFlow

## Overview
This article helps you maximize value from ProjectFlow and achieve your business objectives.

## Success Metrics
Track these to measure your ProjectFlow success:
- Team adoption rate
- Daily active users
- Time saved per week
- Project completion rate
- Team satisfaction score

## Key Success Factors

### 1. Clear Goals
Define what success looks like for your organization:
- Increase productivity
- Improve visibility
- Reduce bottlenecks
- Better collaboration

### 2. Proper Training
Invest in training your team:
- Video tutorials
- Live sessions
- Documentation
- One-on-one coaching

### 3. Regular Reviews
Monitor progress and iterate:
- Weekly check-ins
- Monthly reviews
- Quarterly assessments
- Annual planning

### 4. Continuous Improvement
Optimize your usage:
- Refine workflows
- Add integrations
- Automate processes
- Expand adoption

## Adoption Timeline
- Week 1: Setup and basic training
- Week 2-4: Daily use and feedback
- Month 2: Process optimization
- Month 3+: Full adoption and expansion

## Common Challenges
- Low adoption rates
- Process resistance
- Incomplete migration
- Training gaps

Solutions:
- Stronger leadership support
- Change management plan
- Phased approach
- Comprehensive training

## Quick Wins
Get started with these high-impact initiatives:
- Move project planning to ProjectFlow
- Centralize task management
- Replace email threads with comments
- Implement time tracking

## Next Steps
1. Define your success metrics
2. Create adoption plan
3. Train your team
4. Monitor progress
5. Optimize and expand

Contact your Customer Success Manager for personalized guidance.

records.title: ProjectFlow API Getting Started
records.content:
# ProjectFlow API Getting Started

## Overview
This guide covers ProjectFlow API usage and integration development.

## Getting Started

### 1. Get API Key
From Settings → API Keys, create a new key.

### 2. Install SDK (Optional)
```
pip install projectflow  # Python
npm install projectflow  # Node.js
gem install projectflow  # Ruby
```

### 3. Make Your First Request
```
curl -H "Authorization: Bearer YOUR_KEY" \
  https://api.projectflow.com/v1/projects
```

## API Basics

### Base URL
```
https://api.projectflow.com/v1
```

### Authentication
Include API key in header:
```
Authorization: Bearer sk_live_XXXXX
```

### Response Format
All responses are JSON. Includes status code, data, and errors.

### Pagination
Use limit and offset parameters:
```
?limit=50&offset=0
```

## Common Operations

### List Projects
```
GET /projects
```

### Create Task
```
POST /projects/PROJECT_ID/tasks
Body: {"title": "New task", "assignee": "user_id", "due_date": "2024-12-31"}
```

### Update Task
```
PUT /tasks/TASK_ID
Body: {"status": "completed"}
```

## Error Handling
Handle errors gracefully:
- Check status codes
- Log error details
- Implement retries
- Notify users

## Rate Limits
1000 requests/minute per API key

If exceeded, wait before retrying.

## Best Practices
- Use batch operations
- Cache responses
- Implement webhooks
- Monitor API usage
- Handle timeouts

## Support
Questions? Contact api@projectflow.com
